column4: is there anyway to close all running applications and windows and restore to a state that is the same as having just started up, without restarting?
i just want to go back to the way it was when i started without turning off the computer
what do you think of ariacus' idea?
the alternative is to ALT-TAB and ALT-F4
one by one, if you use the keyboard short cuts it goes quick enough for compulsive window-leaver-openers :)
use compiz to quickly go through the list of stuff?
'killall' say the word kill is more like 'tell it' and TERM means terminate, or please close
it's as safe as you want it to be, that's what I think
do you want commands to type in, or click-and-point?
hey if that works for you, good then :)
eh, some of it will work
why do you need it to work with Ubuntu linux?
what do you mean some of it will work?
are you going to purchase in-person?   It's reasonable to request that the sales person allow you to run a livecd in the system, tell them it is your music or something
yeah i was goinag to buy it in person probably. I'll take a live CD
there are laptops which have been certified for Ubuntu, are you aware?
